WRITING.TEXT: It's worth it to note that these are aggregate win rates, not win rates at the time. When the Azir is at 100 games, they still have to pull up their 35% winrate from when they were learning him. So that likely means that you're winning a whole lot more than 52% of your games.
Except Scarra is mid diamond now, and doesn't affect people like Zven's games.

I haven't set up my flair yet, but I'm a low diamond Azir player, and I actually disagree with most people here. Zed is actually a particularly easy matchup for Azir. You outrange his W-E-Q poke, as long as you position correctly in lane, and he is unable to gap close effectively on you. The 2 keys to this lane are 1: avoiding poke, and 2:Keeping him in front of you, and not behind you, at all times. You completely out poke Zed with the comet build, and its important that you poke him as much as possible to maintain a somewhat even priority in mid lane, so that you can effectively follow Zed to help your Jungler for skirmishes. What I mean by keep Zed in front of you, is that you always want to have an out with your E and your Q. When Zed ults you, he will appear directly behind you, meaning that you can consistently use your own ultimate to CC him before he can use an ability, and W-E yourself to escape. Your W-E is the same length or longer than the Zed's W, and he can't follow you, as he has been pushed even further with your ultimate. Surviving Zed's ultimate with minimal damage remove's Zed's ability to kill you without jungler help, gaining you priority in lane, as you rely on ultimate much less than Zed does. op.gg: http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Battle%20Pigeon
This is absolutely true. https://champion.gg/matchup/Zed/Azir/Middle?league= 46% is significantly higher than Azir's standard winrate, at 45%.

I disagree entirely. Don't Ult Zed back into your tower, he can just escape with W, and kill you while he's at it! When Zed ults, you ult too, and you time it so that you shove him towards his own tower, and immediately dash away. Zed cannot gap close back onto you without both flash and W if you used just W-E, and if you used the full W-E-Q, Zed can't even catch up with a summoner spell.

You don't need to rush Zhonya man, Zed won't be ulting you in teamfights, you have too much crowd control. Seeker's armguard is often enough to deter Zed from ulting you, and if you are far enough ahead that he has to ult you instead of the ADC, then grabbing just a stopwatch is enough to win a key fight. If you still need Zhonyas, you can most of the time delay it until your 3rd item, after oblivion orb at least.
Huh, I have a pretty difficult time with that matchup, any tips?
Ha ha, I was talking about the Yasuo match up
Azir outdamages Zed in teamfights with just oblivion orb, Nashors, and sorc shoes. That sweet double pen and lots of autos does boatloads my man.

Yep, you're gonna suck when you start. I would suggest learning Azir on electrocute, as it teaches you how to properly poke in lane. Most of Azir's difficulty actually comes from positioning, and not combos, so theres not really a set of combos you need to be able to pull off. The one thing I think you need to be able to do is the Shurima shuffle, as it's the only way to set up ganks for your jungler.
NOOOO. Azir is gonna get nerfed after the competitive season :( :( :(.

I got Prestige Akali after 18 days of farming, hitting every daily and every first win bonus, and playing like 6-8 games a day. You have like 21 days. I would say it is highly possible for you to get the skin, but you're going to have to play a LOT of league of legends lol.

I mean, you're going to have to be more specfic. Every champ has a different threat range, and a different position you need to be in, at least in lane. When it comes to teamfight, you always need to position your frontline (or any champion tbh) between you, and the enemy threats. One video that helped me with positioning was this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GwE9wPwHCuU It's not Azir specific, but positioning is not champion specific, so it will help you. The one other thing I would say, is that Azir is uniquely squishy among mages, his base stats are just really low, and he has no self peel outside of his ult. You cannot ever get crowd controlled as Azir in a teamfight, or you will likely lose, or at least lose your ultimate.
In higher elos, you can't just not roam. The best advice when it comes to roaming against champions that can murder you if you follow is to follow at a distance, and take the shorter, longer route.
You could, but why?
ahh mb, ye its too late
Yo bro, you get 50 tokens a day just winning two games and completing ur mission. you can easily get it.

Absolutely its possible. Azir is actually really good right now, because he has severable favorable matchups in the mid lane right now like Lissandra and Galio. As to how long it will take, riot Blastoise recently posted the mastery curve for Azir. It takes about 75 games to reach a 50% wr with the champion, but thats an average, and you could get there faster if you are effective with your practice. The thing about learning a champion like Azir, is that in the long term, it's a good investment of your time. He won't be nerfed if he doesn't see extensive play in competitive, because he already sits at such a low winrate. If you learn Azir now, it will pay dividends in the future. Also, he's like, hella fun.
You're mostly correct, but you did make a slow push, but I think that if you hard shoved you would actually have it shove more quickly back towards you.
So you're gonna knock his socks off?

WRITING.TITLE: Best Shurima shuffle I've ever pulled off! (D3)

WRITING.TEXT: One of Azir's strengths is his safety because of the w e q combo. With proper wave and vision control you honestly should never die to a gank, especially against Nunu Talon who lack strong gap closers. With proper vision control, you can punish roams by shoving into tower, and getting a plate. If you help your teammates to not die from Talon Nunu, using danger and retreat pings, you can gain an advantage, build seekers, and start applying pressure on talon. You asked how do you play when your behind against talon, unfortunately the answer is that you dont. If Azir dies in lane he becomes useless until Nashors, and you cant help your team against a snowballing mid laner. The only way you win from behind is by not getting behind in the first place.
You probably didn't dodge in time, and the game remade!

WRITING.TITLE: As an Azir Main, This is the Best Shuriman Shuffle I've Ever Pulled Off!

WRITING.TEXT: I didn't realize until I made the clip that she left ha ha. I credit my Jungler more than me for that, Zoe got her butt camped off!
They kind of walked into it, but I felt so clean after I did it! Better yet, it was my promo into d2!

Try leaving soldiers behind you over the side wall if you have the mana! Simple and easy escape. Also remember that if you're behind, you don't need to ward the pixel brush, the side brush is often good enough, and you can ward those safely. Lastly, if you shove the wave correctly, you shouldn't miss out on any cs as you place your pink in the pixel brush, simply shove the wave, then head back to your tower, and walk in from the jungle entrance. You're right, if you don't know where Talon is you can't walk into the jungle unless you're willing to use your ult to save yourself.
Gotta love that pigeon
